page.title: 19A DAY IN THE LIFE OF CINDY
page.content: I live on{Strathore farm}on the west of{Shapinsay}.We have 300 cattle.In winter we feed the cattle in the byres.We put the{calves}in their pens because they have been with their mothers all night to be fed.Next we muck out the{byres}with a byre scraper. It is a long pole with a rectangle of rubber on the end.It is used for cleaning out the stalls in which the cows are kept.After that Dad gets the big{tractor scraper},which is attached to the back of our tractor.It pushes out all the dung from the surface of the floor.The cows are fed with silage , which we grow on the {farm}.It is cut in June and stored in our silo pit during the winter. After dinner sometimes we gather stones in our fields.We do this to protect the{cattle's hooves}.Living on a farm is good fun.I like it.
